articles.author: Miranda Murray, Kirsti Knolle
articles.description: Germany searched on Monday for answers on possible security lapses after a man drove his car into a Christmas market, killing at least five people and casting a renewed spotlight on security and immigration ahead of a snap election.
articles.title: Germany probing possible security lapses after Christmas market attack

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Luigi Mangione, the man suspected of fatally gunning down UnitedHealth Group chief executive Brian Thompson on a Manhattan street, is due to be arraigned on Monday on state murder charges that brand him a terrorist.
articles.title: Suspect in UnitedHealth CEO's killing faces terrorism charges in New York

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: A fresh bid by mediators Egypt, Qatar and the United States to end the fighting and release Israeli and foreign hostages has gained momentum this month.
articles.title: Some gaps have narrowed in elusive Gaza ceasefire deal, sides say

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Tim Reid
articles.description: Trump signals that he will pursue a foreign policy unbound by diplomatic niceties.
articles.title: Trump previews combative foreign policy with threats to Panama, Greenland

articles.author: Amina Ismail, Firas Makdesi
articles.description: Syrian church leaders are advising Christians to scale back Christmas celebrations this year, despite assurances from the Islamists who have just taken power that they are free to practise their religion.
articles.title: Syria's Christians fearful of new Islamist leaders as Christmas approaches

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Defense Minister Israel Katz admitted on Monday for the first time publicly to Israel's killing of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Iran in July, further risking tensions between Tehran and its arch-enemy Israel in a region shaken by Israel's war in Gaza and the conflict in Lebanon.
articles.title: Israeli defense minister claims responsibility for first time for Hamas leader Haniyeh's assassination

articles.author: David Ljunggren
articles.description: The ruling Liberals face obliteration in the next election after more than nine years in office amid voter fatigue as well as anger over high prices and a housing crisis.
articles.title: Canada's Trudeau faces increasing pressure from his own MPs to quit

articles.author: Maggie Fick, Ahmed Aboulenein
articles.description: Members of Donald Trump's presidential transition team are laying the groundwork for the United States to withdraw from the World Health Organization on the first day of his second term, according to a health law expert familiar with the discussions.
articles.title: Trump transition team plans immediate WHO withdrawal, expert says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Jordan stands ready to help Syria rebuild, its foreign minister said after meeting Syria's new de facto ruler Ahmed al-Sharaa in Damascus on Monday, the highest-level contact by an Arab state with Syria's new Islamist-led administration.
articles.title: Jordan offers Syria support in meeting with new leader

articles.author: Costas Pitas
articles.description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump will take office on Jan. 20 after defeating Democratic candidate Kamala Harris in November's presidential election.
articles.title: Trump’s inauguration: Key dates and what to expect
